datafield.subfield: We study the bulk viscosity taking dust matter in the generalized teleparallel gravity. We consider different dark energy models in this scenario along with a time dependent viscous model to construct the viscous equation of state parameter for these dark energy models. We discuss the graphical representation of this parameter to investigate the viscosity effects on the accelerating expansion of the universe. It is mentioned here that the behavior of the universe depends upon the viscous coefficients showing the transition from decelerating to accelerating phase. It leads to the crossing of phantom divide line and becomes phantom dominated for specific ranges of these coefficients.

00000 Plot of time dependent viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for first model with $c=0.818,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, we take $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.1=\xi_2$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.05=\xi_2$.

00001 Plot of time dependent viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for first model with $c=0.818,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, we take $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.1=\xi_2$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.05=\xi_2$.
00002 Plot of constant viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for first model with $c=0.818,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=0.82$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.05$.
00003 Plot of constant viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for first model with $c=0.818,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=0.82$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.05$.

00008 Plot of time dependent viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for third model with $n=2.716,~h=2,~a_0=1,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=0.05,~\xi_1=4.2=\xi_2$ and in the right graph $\xi_0=0.05,~\xi_1=2.6=\xi_2$.

00009 Plot of time dependent viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for third model with $n=2.716,~h=2,~a_0=1,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=0.05,~\xi_1=4.2=\xi_2$ and in the right graph $\xi_0=0.05,~\xi_1=2.6=\xi_2$.
00010 Plot of constant viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for third model with $n=2.716,~h=2,~a_0=1,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=32$ and in the right graph $\xi_0=20$.
00011 Plot of constant viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for third model with $n=2.716,~h=2,~a_0=1,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=32$ and in the right graph $\xi_0=20$.
00006 Plot of constant viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for exponential model with $b=0.05,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=1.6$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.5$.
00007 Plot of constant viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for exponential model with $b=0.05,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, $\xi_0=1.6$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.5$.

00004 Plot of time dependent viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for exponential model with $b=0.05,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, we take $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.2=\xi_2$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.02=\xi_2$.

00005 Plot of time dependent viscous $\omega_{eff}$ versus $z$ for exponential model with $b=0.05,~h=2,~\kappa^2=1=\rho_{m0}$. In the left graph, we take $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.2=\xi_2$ and in the right graph, $\xi_0=0.005,~\xi_1=0.02=\xi_2$.
